title: fmt: type containing procedures looks off with --indent-unit
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/472

First of all: Great stuff!
I tried `lfortran fmt` with some of my files and found the following:
```fortran
module test
  implicit none
  private

  type, public :: option
    character(:), allocatable :: help
  contains
    procedure :: print_info
  end type option

  interface option
    procedure new_option
  end interface option

contains

  type(option) function new_option(help)
    implicit none
    character(*), optional, intent(in) :: help
    new_option%help = "No description"
    if (present(help)) new_option%help = help
  end function new_option

  subroutine print_info(self)
    implicit none
    class(option), intent(inout) :: self
    print *, self%help
  end subroutine print_info

end module test
```
Applying
```bash
lfortran fmt --spaces 2 --indent-unit test.f90
```
I get:
```fortran
module test
  implicit none
  private
  type, public :: option
    character(len=:), allocatable :: help

contains

procedure :: print_info
  end type option
interface option
    procedure new_option
end interface option

contains

  type(option) function new_option(help)
    implicit none
    character(len=*), optional, intent(in) :: help
    new_option%help = "No description"
    if (present(help)) then
      new_option%help = help
    end if
  end function new_option

  subroutine print_info(self)
    implicit none
    class(option), intent(inout) :: self
    print *, self%help
  end subroutine print_info

end module test
```

I think the part:
```fortran
contains

procedure :: print_info
```
looks off and should be indented. What do you think?

Cheers,
Sebastian
